intro: Ozothamnus rogersianus, commonly known as Rogers' golden weed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. The plant has silver-gray foliage and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and drought tolerance. Ozothamnus rogersianus is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
